tool_description: 2024, Real-time and cheapest tiktok API, User, Video, Shop, Hashtag, Search, High Quality, Reliable tiktok api solutions
name: TikTok Shop
title: TikTok Shop

api_list.name: /hashtag/{hashtag_id}
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://tiktok-shop2.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/hashtag/2878999"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "tiktok-shop2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

import requests

url = "https://tiktok-shop2.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/hashtag/{hashtag_id}"

api_list.name: /shop/products/{user_id}/detail_page
api_list.description: Product List on Seller Details Page

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: If in a response you get parameter has_more equal to 1 then you also have 'next_cursor' value for a next request

optional_parameters.name: region
optional_parameters.description: Alpha-2 country code

api_list.name: /shop/products/{user_id}/tab_list
api_list.description: List of available tabs on the seller's details page

api_list.name: /shop/search

optional_parameters.name: filters_data
optional_parameters.description:
All available filters can be found under \"filter\\_groups\" field from response.
The \"filters\\_data\" value must be JSON array in format: [{simple filter button},{range/multiple select}, and more filters].

Example for {simple filter button} - {\"type\": 2, \"value\": \"true\"}.
Example for {range/multiple select} - {\"type\":8, \"value\\_list\": [\"1,1000\"]}.

Full example with filter by \"price\" and \"4 Stars & Up\": [{\"type\": 2, \"value\": \"true\"},{\"type\":8, \"value\\_list\": [\"1,1000\"]}]

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: If in a response you get parameter has_more equal to 1 then you also have 'next_cursor' value for a next request

optional_parameters.name: sort_by
optional_parameters.description: Sort types, possible values: PRICE\\_ASC, PRICE\\_DESC, BEST\\_SELLERS, RELEVANCE

api_list.name: /shop/flash_sale
api_list.description: List of products from flash sale event

optional_parameters.name: tab_id
optional_parameters.description: from 'data.event_tab_list[].tab_list[].tab_id'

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: If in a response you get parameter has_more equal to 1 then you also have 'next_cursor' value for a next request

optional_parameters.name: event_id
optional_parameters.description: from 'data.event_tab_list[].event_id'

optional_parameters.name: session_id
optional_parameters.description: from 'data.event_tab_list[].session_id'

api_list.name: /shop/new_user_exclusive_deal
api_list.description: List of products for new users

optional_parameters.name: session_id
optional_parameters.description: from 'data.event_tab_list[].session_id'

optional_parameters.name: tab_type
optional_parameters.description: from 'data.main\\_tab\\_list[].tab\\_type'

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: If in a response you get parameter has_more equal to 1 then you also have 'next_cursor' value for a next request

optional_parameters.name: main_tab_id
optional_parameters.description: from 'data.main\\_tab\\_list[].main\\_tab\\_id'

optional_parameters.name: sub_tab_id
optional_parameters.description: from 'data.main\\_tab\\_list[].tab\\_list[].sub\\_tab\\_id'

api_list.name: /shop/product/{product_id}/reviews

optional_parameters.name: region
optional_parameters.description: Alpha-2 country code

optional_parameters.name: sort_type
optional_parameters.description: 1 - Sort by Relevance, 2 - Sort by Recent

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: If in a response you get parameter has_more equal to 1 then you also have 'next_cursor' value for a next request

optional_parameters.name: filter_id
optional_parameters.description: Value from data.review_filters[].filter_id

api_list.name: /user/uid/{username}
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://tiktok-shop2.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/user/uid/nike"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "tiktok-shop2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

/search/user

optional_parameters.name: follower_count
optional_parameters.description: Filter by followers count, can be empty or one of: ZERO_TO_ONE_K(0 to 1k), ONE_K_TO_TEN_K(1k to 10k), TEN_K_TO_ONE_H_K(10k to 100k), ONE_H_K_PLUS(100k+)

optional_parameters.name: profile_type
optional_parameters.description: Filter by user profile type, can be empty or VERIFIED

optional_parameters.name: other_pref
optional_parameters.description: Filter by other preference, can be empty or one of: USERNAME (keyword usage in username)

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: If in a response you get parameter hasMore equal to 1 then you also have cursor value for a next set

api_list.name: /search/post

optional_parameters.name: sort_type
optional_parameters.description: Sort type, can be empty or one of: 3 - Date posted, 1 - Most liked, 0 - Relevance

optional_parameters.name: region
optional_parameters.description: Alpha-2 country code

optional_parameters.name: publish_time
optional_parameters.description: Date posted filter, can be empty or one of: 0 - All time, 1 - Yesterday, 7 - This week, 30 - This month, 90 - Last 3 months, 180 - Last 6 months

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: If in a response you get parameter hasMore equal to 1 then you also have cursor value for a next set
